zkHPvMA3307122TSfSdOfg.text: Omygoodness what an awesome burger!! The place is spotless, the Staff is friendly and efficient and they serve up THE best burgers on the planet!  My humble opinion after 85 years on earth.

QrhAVzjuH2Kx5nJpvDJQ_w.text: After all the hype what a let down.  Very limited menu offerings, way over priced, and food was nothing special.  Can get several burgers that are much better within a few miles.  How it can cost $48 for 2 burgers, 3 small fries, 1 extra patty, 2 small shakes and one drink is beyond me.  Staff is poorly trained.  Didn't know the menu to the point that they don't even know they have pickles, gluten free buns or what a concrete is (even though they are predominately featured on the menu and signage.  Don't waste your time and money.

T0UX-0SfqV4GZ9KNAeoLIQ.text: What's not to love?! Burger, fries and a shake!  So glad hear came to Charlotte!  It is our family go to when we want a good burger and treat (shake) for kiddo!

kXntM17ymreozWeBwuZeWA.text: I ate at the Blakeney location.  Quick service.  I order the Hamburger in a lettuce wrap.  So no bun.  My spouse gets the fries and I do have to sample one.  Can't wait till warm weather allows us to sit outside.

X__4qiPBNbUSZYc7hwYHVg.text: This was the most disappointing place......my burger was chewy and I kept getting grizzle....gross!!!!  The burger was small, but even so I didn't eat all of it because of the nasty grizzle and chewiness.....the fries reminded me of cafeteria fries in high school...ugh Really?   My hubby had chicken sandwich and said chick fila is MUCH better!   Our friends also had burgers and we all walked away feeling like we wish we had went some place else!!

dKFc6OdwEeiCp_DC4imk9g.text: Food is awesome, affordable as well!  Friendly staff, but do come early or avoid lunch time as it fills up quickly!

9S-VWc1bZYOGZhmo82Szlw.text: Went to the Ballantyne location shortly after they opened. There was no line which I was surprised about as I kept hearing there were long lines still at the Park Rd. location. The staff was not friendly, from the person who took my order to the person who gave me my food.  They made me feel like I was an interruption to their day. The burger was small but tasted good, but fries had an odd after taste. Not worth the hype.

_XnJV4zKd62Ac5JiVQXvnQ.text: When I went there the burger was gross and small and the milkshake was terrible. No one in my family finished our food. Our cousins thought it would be good since it's in NY but they mistakened.

73IfwELY9zBYHF-JluyJzw.text: Overrated and overhyped! I was excited to try a Shake Shack, what a huge disappointment. This is definitely a one and done for me. $15 for a single shack burger, fries and a shake. What a joke. The burger was small and had no flavor. The fries were the worst I've ever had, overcooked and brittle. The shake was meh, very small for $6. Spend the $15 elsewhere, you'll get a better meal.

rS1I4sfCFLtQdpPXmiRYCQ.text: Over-priced for the qualify of food.  Dining area is highly inadequate and we were forced to sit outside where our food got cold rather quickly (no heating).  The portions are woefully inadequate for the price point; our teenage son was still hungry after eating one of their larger-sized burgers.  Fountain drinks were poorly mixed and for the amount of money we spent for a family of four, we should have gone to a burger sit-down restaurant (like Bad Daddy's).

2JOin8sDl1ecEoBnT4nWzw.text: Could work on their customer service but by far the best burger I've ever had in my life.

ie11QvR2dRXe1Cc7F4fwiQ.text: We visited the Shake Shack today for lunch with our two young grandchildren.  There was no kids menu listed and the shakes were over $5.00!  Definitely should have a kids price milkshake.  And, there are no healthy choices at all.  My husband's hamburger was small and very mediocre.  A couple of salads would be welcomed!  For $42.00 for two adults and two children is way too pricey for a not very satisfying lunch!  Will not go back.

KK60oGza5opfPAcOS3KPgQ.text: Thought the food was great! thinner patties, so a double stack is great. I misunderstood the menu and ordered the wrong item. They didn't hesitate to quickly rectify my order w a fresh sandwich, even though i was at fault. Casual spot w great food and Stellar customer service! Will definitely go back!

vKxhpcWvnpcCbyaXs3-X6A.text: Burgers and beer are tasty. Fries aren't bad but not amazing. The chicken bites are delicious! I'd come back again.

ZRHuuyYJL2NjiDDy0ZoBTA.text: There are far too many burger places in South Charlotte to return to the Shake shack. My family and I visited last weekend, the place was packed, people were hovering over other peoples tables in hopes of grabbing one when someone got up to leave. Definitely not enough seating, especially when it's cold and rainy outside and no one wants to sit on the covered patio. The fries were bland, and while the burgers were good, they were no better than five guys. Will stick with five guys for a quick burger and delicious fries and Bad Daddys for a fun burger night out. Shake shack was far too Expensive for the quality and service we received.

d8vh60nqS5ePr9edMAi58A.text: Service was excellent!  Very friendly staff.  Unfortunately   the food was only ok.  Not bad but nothing special and certainly not worth the price.

MNNa1joo1bQGRW38iEjL_w.text: Yeah burger is good as is everything else there. But it's (1) way overpriced for what you get and (2) way way too slow for fast food (and also way slower even than your average shake shack I've been to outside of Charlotte).  I don't know how this place can survive doing what they're doing.   Decent to good food, but stingy portions at gouging prices with slow service. It's not been crowded when I've been there and that's understandable.

hZi0or9u-9hqh_if5TG4Jg.text: I don't get it.  Shake Shack is nothing but hype. Sure the burger was good, but it was nothing special.  The same can be said of the fries.  If you want a good burger and fry combination then 5 Guys will Trump this place each and every time.

bTj_C50il6QzdwF_Jr8Nig.text: Very tasty burger!  I had a double cheeseburger, cheese fries and soda.  Good service and extremely clean.  The price is a bit high, but this is way beyond a McDonald's burger.

2N0lJX0e0OpxzIp8U6IRnA.text: So glad they are here! Best burger and shakes around. Seating can be an issue, but as long as you aren't in a hurry it's worth the wait.

p799-qkZ1dtghTtbtKm1hA.text: Tried their soft opening on first day, yesterday when they were handing out free meals.   Burger was good, especially the buns were soft. Fries were average , similar to the frozen crinkle cut you can fry at home.  The shake was really good and that's what explains their name.   All in all a great customer service despite hoards of people waiting in line.  Would visit again for shakes.

-SQ1zcr7v9TPT3aLWYhbwA.text: Greasy food, cheap napkins, mayo in packets, droopy fries. $50 pissed through a grease drain

9s5fDdmnQK7O5mGiZad1Zg.text: I don't get the hoopla on this place.  First 3 of use spent over $30 on 3 burgers, 2 fries and 3 sodas.  We left starving.  $6 for a small burger or $9 for double patty.  Stand in line to order, stand in line to squirt mustard and ketchup in a cup, stand in line to pick up food and get drink.  I mean at least put ketchup and mustard on the tables.  Here's an idea go to 5 Guys, Bad Daddy's, American burger and get more food and service for your money.  Food was good but not that good, it's a burger.

AYAig6WvGN_G7oy897Nt-g.text: It's a burger ppl!  Maybe I'm spoiled having been at an office that was across from the original.  The shakes are great.  Frozen crinkles from my fav potato manufacturer especially when thrown in a fryer taste about the same.  A light pink not juicy burger that is the size of one served at a tapas place is def not what I remember.  Shake Shack being a chain at this point has the $$ to put up for a pick your flavor Coke machine which would have more caffeine free options than the sugar laden flavored Fantas.  All in all not the experience I recalled and will be walking the extra 250 steps past for a juicier alternative.

QaeY50JfR9_N7dhhnv25hA.text: I've been to Shake Shacks in NY, MA, and NJ. I expected the same service and quality of food but a little bit disappointed with the orders I made so far. All 3 visits, orders I made wasn't exactly executed. I had to go back and ask to make it right. Burger meat is still fresh and juicy as other places!!

O2K-Y52cY0HSB9s7JLTRVw.text: Was worried because of the reviews, but just ate here. Food took 5 mins to come out (eat in). Burger was hot, but I would say it on the small side for the price. Good flavor, had the SmokeShack. I ordered the Coffee shake and came out nice and cold, and thick.

Syzgf_YfwR4reLYIDH4DEA.text: I must say that I really liked the burger at shake shack. I love 5 guys burgers but this is a close second.

vePMm-5jzCuynEF6z2oWGg.text: Having visited other SS locations I knew what to expect...decent burgers but not the best, fries ok and a great shake.  Been to this location twice and pretty much what I anticipated.  What was disappointing was how small the restaurant was.  Seating was limited and people waiting and fighting to get a table.  Not a great spot for larger families or groups because you would probably have to split up.  Dining room was cramped and noise level high.  Although I will probably go back from time to time, there are other places I would frequent when the burger craving hits.

7EVclu-pWATKrmW_EC1CkQ.text: Good food and service but not enough seating. The interior design is awful - so much wasted space. They desperately need to reconfigure tables and seating. We have been to shacks in NYC, Philly and here. We enjoy their burgers, LOVE their chicken sandwiches and fries. The fried portabello shack is really good too. Good shakes also. Hey SS, enclose your patio and add heaters - instant extra seating!

mDIh9caFP2kCmxFszMPGkA.text: Shockingly bad given the hype. Burger ok. Shake melty and runny and get this regarding the root beer float- we got a half full cup with ice cream and were told to go over to fill cup at drink stand with root beer. When we did it never mixed well and was undrinkable. Fries were cold.   Five guys puts this place to shame.

XKgTiNwlvp6rwCTE5zDawQ.text: Can't really go wrong with Shake Shack. Firstly, my suggestion would to not come to this location on a lunch break that's less than an hour. Reason being, it is always poppin. The wait is about 15-20 mins if you order at the counter during peak time, which honestly.... it's worth the wait. I typically order a Shake Shack burger & a milkshake but today I wanted to try the hot dog and I'm so glad I did. The hot dog is crunchy & the slaw has a spice to it that offsets the sweetness of the mustard. The fries are always awesome. They've managed to perfect the act of frying a thick cut French fry to a gorgeous golden brown, where it crunches in your mouth but still so soft in the center. I've also order the crispy chicken sandwich (I'm not a huge fan of chicken) but it was also delicious. My only feedback would be to be a little more efficient with pumping out orders. Seems a little all over the place (and I'm a very understanding person) & also more seating would be nice. The outside area is beautiful, (if you've been to the Blakeney Park shopping center you'll know) which is where I chose (well, was forced) to eat. Overall, this is a perfect lunch spot and there's plenty of parking options!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

YzQCf_NJp7QtOsgg6U7YXA.text: Love this place! Service is always friendly! The food is Amazing! I Love the sauce they put on the burgers! Fries are so yummy!

gL4QdaRH8RLLcRqdaH9LCw.text: Very disappointing. Been many in NYC and just not same. Burger was salty.  Not juicy like they come right off grill Dont think I'm coming back

VP1Stb67OtwQPaBQQNXLqA.text: I liked my food at Shake Shack (the Shack burger, fries and a chocolate shake), but I feel like In N Out tastes a little better and is MUCH cheaper. Nothing wrong with the food at all- it tastes great, but I just don't think it lived up to the hype (or the price).  Also, this location is always short on seating, even though they have additional outdoor seating-- it's so hard to find somewhere to sit. And the tables are very close together. Employees were nice and it had a fun vibe, I just think it's overrated.

ctd4lfJCfzzw90_LVjqOiQ.text: I had take out a few times.  Not impressed.  I may give it another chance but if it's not great again, will stick with little big burger.

GEu__cQMkYMZrLHt9FZq6A.text: I really liked Shake Shack!  I originally heard some negative comments about the food and lines but I ended up having a great experience.  One of my friends was passing through Charlotte so we decided to grab a quick bite to eat.  There was a small line but it moved extremely fast.  Almost every table inside and out was full but thankfully we found an open table for all four of us.  We got our condiments and then had a short wait for our food.  We all got burgers and fries.  They do give you a large portion of fries so you are able to share them between two people which is what my husband and I did. I got a burger with lettuce and tomato and it was absolutely delicious!  The crinkle fries were also SOOO good!  I was expecting not to love them but they were the perfect amount of crisp and potato!  I highly recommend going here, and I highly recommend you taking me with you!

Kri_3YoPIZJK2oU6QY9Wkg.text: Maybe 3 stars is a bit generous!  Five Guys CRUSHES this place!!!!  Ordered take out,  waited waaaaayyy too long for our order,  it was not bagged to go, items were missing, then I get home NO ShackSauce!!  What do you have.....A DRY, COLD BURGER, YUCK!  Not a good first impression at all.  Very dissatisfied with my hamburger, and I love hamburgers!!!  I am not sure if I will ever go back and that is too bad.  I was super excited about this place opening up in my backyard.   But I do have to say their custard (vanilla and chocolate) and root beer floats are OUTSTANDING!!

1AYlc8lwgB5pxYI7MAe57g.text: This was our first time at a shake shack. Glad to see a new place occupie the restaurant, as we entered we were greeted by a friendly cashier who explained how it works. That part was good.  We were wondering how they stacked up to Five guys and as of right now they have nothing to worry about. I know it has only been a month or so but we waited 10 to 15 minutes for our food and sadly my burger was like warm at best. We will try them again as the weather warms and sit outside and try one of their milkshakes.

OHG5S-d9eIx1P_Sm6hN46g.text: Very nice restaurant and location. Great attentive customer service. This is a great addition to the  Blakeney food mix. Burger was very fresh and we'll seasoned, my only complaint is that the beef pattie was on the pink rare side. Not sure if this is the norm but will definitely ask for a well done burger on my next visit. Fries were hot and crunchy and the Christmas cookie shake was very good. Will definitely try them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. A bit too rare for my liking.
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Finally here!

LxpwIroHrq8B4ES4cmqAqw.text: I don't know what it is with all these bad reviews. I LOVED SHAKE SHACK! I am in love with this place. The burgers are fresh and juicy and cooked to perfection. I LOVE the fact that they are served on warm potato buns. The fries are so good. I'm usually not a fan of crinkle cuts, but these are amazing! Crispy and delicious, unlike most soft and soggy ones. The cheese and bacon just took it to a whole new level. I recommend the Shark Attack Concrete. IT IS AMAZING! I CANNOT WAIT TO GO BACK!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shake shack is da bomb

R-eY_XsowJjR9fLDW8yfzQ.text: At long last a nearby Shake Shack but it meets with lower than expected enthusiasm.  Burgers were good, fries good and shakes great.  It seems the new staff is still working to find their flow but all were pleasant and friendly.  A little more than disappointing was the "hidden" upcharge for whipped cream on the shakes.  We're already expending a little more than normal for a burger fries and shake so to upcharge the already $5+ shake by 50 cents was a bit ridiculous for my liking.  Glad we enjoyed our food but not likely making Shake Shack a frequent eatery on our list.

kugrDcRDyw33DPMFzHZ5Qg.text: I was very unimpressed with this place. There was so much hype but it was really like any other fast food burger joint around. The menu was also really small. If you order the cheesy bacon fried to go they will pack the bacon and cheese separately. The packaging for the food itself wasn't very protective and left the food exposed

4vGtgu7t5t5C0YfKJ84JZg.text: Not very impressed, thought I would try this place because of all the hype about it, but the prices are extremely high and the food is OK but not worth the price, and their custard is OK and a very small cone at that. You can get better burgers and custard at Culvers or Freddys for a lot less money. A single cheeseburger, fries, small drink and a single dip cone for $17? I do like the crispier fries.  Custard is ok (if it is indeed custard) but Culver's is better.

U-WbvG2jGBYxgKx7JmncGQ.text: As a long time supporter of Shake Shack, going back to NYC, this location fits right in. They've had some "just opened" growing pains, along with lines outside the door on both of my visits. The food is spot on, great job of recreating that buttered bun magic here in Charlotte. As for the location, it's in Blakeney (despite indications of Ballantyne). And, during warm weather months it will be even more crowded as they've got outdoor seating and are adjacent to the Blakeney fountains.  Despite what others may have written, Shake Shack's arrival is bad news for the nearby Five Guys. Both are burger joints, with the Five Guys staff and local service lacking. Shack Shack's employees were cheery and helpful despite the fast paced customer action.  If you're looking for one thing to try on the menu, I've been loving the Shack Stack lately. That's a single patty with the 'shroom burger in one sandwich, delish!!

H0IBrRlt1V3k-2-IfLd2fA.text: Their burgers fries and shakes are the absolute best. Sometimes they're out of the cheese fries but other than that it's good. Also they are very pricey but I love the food so it gets the 5 stars!

DCOgNxQ6Lsjw3Jt966KNaQ.text: I read the reviews and should've listened.... This is an order first at the register and hope you can find a table kinda place. Honestly, it's very expensive fast food.... Not to mention that literally all of us have had tummy problems since . I'll be sticking with Chik fil a...... At least they are polite there.... ( Plus the menu is pretty slim.... Not too many options other than shakes... We won't be back.)

6ZNPJtWzF3Xz-ACriazGrw.text: Once again something comes to this side of Hwy 51 and it is a disappointment. As others have said yes Shake Shack is a chain and it is fast food somewhat, but service and consistency is the backbone of this company. Having visited a NYC location multiple times my family was excited when Shake Shack arrived in Charlotte. I have been a patron multiple times to the other location. We decided to grab a concrete on the way home since we have a location closer to home. We got it to go. I wish I had looked more closely as we got a half a serving compared to concretes served at the other locations.  Based on the other reviews and customers that expect different based on the reputation of Shake Shack it seems this location needs to step it up. Very disappointing and though I may give another chance for food if necessary I will drive to the other location to get what I pay for.

sYzNnwkcEisVnd7kgymFCw.text: Burgers we cooked perfectly, medium!  my son had a double burger with lettuce/tomato.  I had their version of a bacon cheeseburger, fries and vanilla shake.  The shake was amazing if you like frozen custard.  Still like 5guys fries better but I think the burger is better here.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

yfsvILY0YmiU5jp1Ip6vAA.text: Either too rare or too burned.  Fries were good.  Order had to be returned but how they managed the situation was good.

I2tv52nkv1fiKlsJpGo_9A.text: Me and my husband love shake shack and get it frequently. We decided to get it tonight to-go and we are very disappointed. The employees seemed annoyed that we were ordering and were rude and unfriendly. Once we got home with our food we realized that my husband's order was completely wrong - his burger had no toppings/sauce! :( very disappointed with shake shack

a1vqbHON91nnKQHaf_lVDw.text: Ok, so I finally caved and opted to give it a try. I offer this review with the disclaimer that we ordered it to go and it was not at "peak time". Service was A-OK and they were quick to offer suggestions (I agree with previous reviewer that even a lame salad as a healthy option would be a good idea). Everything is FRIED. That said, I went whole hog on this trip and got the fried mushroom burger with cheese (& a burger patty). It was tasty, it was hot and yes, the fries were crispy & fresh. I'd say the competitor next door definitely wins the fry competition hands down - but I enjoyed the burger. Our "mini" (aka: child) really loved his meal - but he's clearly the perfect audience for this cuisine. Hubs said he definitely prefers shake shack burgers and agrees on fries. I suppose a loyalist could do the burger from one and fries from another.......... milkshakes are good (we got one) but it didn't hold the test of the drive home - was soupy and kinda lame by the time we got it home. (And who drinks the shake BEFORE the burger?!?). I wish them success but admit I miss the sit down options in Blakeney - too many fast casual options and not as many True family-style places that are affordable. (Love 131, but that's not quite the price point for families "anytime"). Hope this is helpful for others considering trying shake shack!

9-8lZsIZtNB3x8P6jg0xrQ.text: What a Difference a few days makes. My second time there I really thoroughly enjoyed the burgers what a great restaurant I will be back no doubt about it.

g3HDQ_dw7QJB-y8N62h4Rw.text: This place has really great burgers and the service is also nice. It is simple but good.

DR470qaUsaSntbsIrc8akg.text: My family and I love shake shack! Their chicken sandwich is soooooo good!!! We all have found something we love which makes it easy! My son loves their burgers and shakes! Highly recommend

J9LIa3ynRLfi6V0BgKy1wA.text: Enjoyable cookies and cream milkshake! I liked the cookies and cream milkshake. It had a dense vanilla flavor with tiny cookie pieces. I think the price was a little high for the flavors,  $6.16. I prefer other ice creams for this kind of money. And I am okay to pay high prices for ice cream if it's amazing. They weren't crowded on a random weekday afternoon around 3 pm. I think the service was good, I had a beeper that let me know when my order was ready. I am curious about the food but probably not going to wait in long lines for it. Parking is crazy in blakeney so park and walk is my motto there.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu 2019

U1pzivAA6FIyf4rSYUIjuw.text: 6/27/19 SmokeShack burger very good - enjoyed the spicy peppers  on it. Liked the crinkle fries  Too bad postmates .. brought the food cold. Definitely try this place again ..

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. 6/27/19

bLpH8kxdcsfxQAtF9BivIQ.text: Wife here: The hamburger was juicy and omg delicious & flavorful. The fries were crispy & tasty. We were very surprised how good the meal was on a Tuesday night. Service was outstanding. The manager at this location is doing a great job. Love this place.

F5pCLLjBhmHAdFNYrOoW0A.text: A single burger, fries and small shake cost me $14.67 for lunch. While you digest that and calculate what it would run a family of four to dine here, I'll tell you about my meal...  The burger was tasty and fresh, however, I would have preferred a cheeseburger, but the only cheese option is American. Those of us who prefer anything else are out of luck. How difficult would it be to at least offer a cheddar alternative?  The fries are nothing special. They appear to be the krinkle cut variety found in your grocer's frozen food case. They were piping hot however.  The shake was delicious but no better than Steak n' Shake's or Burger 21's, and at $5?! C'mon man!   Service was adequate and the place was clean  yet somewhat sterile in atmosphere. Overall, my meal was good but with the plethora of comparable burger joints in Charlotte, this place just doesn't stand out. Yeah, it is a step up from 5 Guys, which is located a few steps away, but I can think of a half dozen or so better (and more affordable) options.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger, fries and small shake for $14.67.
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside and outside dining available
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order at counter...

M2U2da8K6CubxZogsQL65Q.text: I was not impressed. I wanted the 'Shroom Burger ($6.89) but was told that it wasn't a "real burger," so the staff changed it to the Shack Stack ($9.59) instead. They said the 'Shroom burger was like a vegetarian burger, that it did not have a bun or meat. This should be clarified on the menu, and definitely not listed in the middle of the "Burgers" menu. The burger tasted good (I especially liked the crispy fried portobello mushroom with the melted muenster and cheddar cheeses), but it was certainly not worth almost $10. The Chick'n Bites ($4.59 for 6 pieces, $6.59 for 10 pieces) are tiny and not very impressive either. Outdoor seating was nice though. A couple dog bowls are available for your furry friends. They have giant Jenga pieces, a ping pong table, and cornhole as well for entertainment.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Desserts menu
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drinks menu
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Alcohol menu

Lx3btzqb463hDq7rNyvtTQ.text: **Update** My first visit here was not the greatest, but as I stated before, I was looking forward to trying them again. The cool thing is, I ended up speaking to a store manager about my visit and they are welcoming me back to give them another try. They understood the situation and were sincere about making sure people are happy. Previously, I was not aware that they had only been opened for a month. They still have some kinks to work out. The manager knows they need to fix things to get off to a good start in Charlotte. There are lots of places to get a burger, competition is real. I'm sure after the employees get more experience, their ratings will be much better. I cant wait to give them another visit. I know the food is good, they just need to iron out some processes and personnel issues.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon cheeseburger &amp; bacon cheese fries

-L89PezpUadddyEWPORDmw.text: The important thing with Shake Shack is to set realistic expectations.  The hype is crazy and does a disservice to the food.  We found the food solid and a strong competitor to Five Guys or Culver's.  The burgers were good and simple.  We loved the fries too.  My Hot Chicken sandwich was very good with the right amount of spice.  Our family of four enjoyed a meal of 3 fries, 3 burgers, and one Hot chicken sandwich. The final price was $48 (with drinks).  It was an ok value for the food.  They should do well in the area.  It's nice to have another alternative for burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

_38XAj7omzhVRJqcJxBgSw.text: Finally got the chance to try Shake Shack today after seeing so many reports on how good it is. I don't eat hamburgers in general very often and it has been at least 5 years since I've had a burger from a fast food joint, but when I bit into the burger I got - the SmokeShack - it reminded me vaguely of a Wendy's hamburger. The first few bites didn't have ShackSauce, but once I got to the part with the sauce, it made the burger a lot better. The burger was pretty good but way overpriced for what it was. Honestly with $15 for 2 single burgers and no sides, your money could be stretched a bit farther for a similar quality meal.

VyarjCN4xJ5HeSo2-38bDw.text: I came to shake shack craving a burger so I got the smoke shack with fries. I love their shack sauce, their service is fast the line moves quickly. The prices can be higher cause it's alittle more upscale. Next time I want to try the shake. I would return

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoke shack burger   with fries

INRyBfQw_dUIKj257gi0pA.text: To be completely honest... this place is just eh. Shake Shack has a ton of hype around it and it's just not all that in my eyes! Is it good? Absolutely. Is it the best burger/fries/chicken I've ever had? Not even close.  While their food is not the best, their milkshakes are pretty jam up!

Za2HXShQGTno2edRn5fKLw.text: Always clean environment. Food always fresh and very delicious. Go early because it gets crowded quick.

jMeJum7_vmyswAvbHmni_w.text: Wow the experience I had today was disgusting. My mother and I decided to come in for lunch today as I am nine months pregnant and craving a burger. We ordered two smokehouse burgers and a fry to share. We got our drinks and waited for our food patiently. When my mom came back with the burgers she noticed that one of them was missing bacon so she went back up to the counter and was handed a cup with bacon in it. Not ideal but it was fine. I then noticed that the burger that was missing bacon was also missing other toppings such as the cherry peppers the lettuce and the onions and sauce that were supposed to be on the burger. We ordered two of the same burger so it was a bit confusing why one burger was completely different from the other. I went back up to the counter where we went to get the cup of bacon and explained to the woman working that these burgers were supposed to be the same and they were not so if she could please reassemble the burger and add the correct toppings that would be very helpful. She looked at me as if I was asking for something outrageous rolled her eyes and took the tray and proceeded to speak loudly that I wanted my burger remade. While I waited my mom started eating the french fries because that's all we had from our order as they took the tray with both burgers on it away so I decided to go to the register to order another order of fries. While I was waiting for someone to come to the register I could overhear the girl from the window and other employees talking about me and not in a nice way. Claiming that they didn't know what I was wanting or what my problem was or why I was making such a big deal that I just Wanted a free burger. Let me reiterate what I said earlier the burger i ordered and paid for was not Not what I received so I asked for it to be fixed so that it was in fact what I ordered. I was not asking for a free burger and I was not making a huge deal of it I simply asked for my burger to be made correctly and if they could just put the toppings on it that would be fine. Another woman came from around the corner and told me that once the burger is assembled they can't take it back and I said that's fine but the burger I received is not what I ordered so I would just like a burger that I ordered and paid for I'm not understanding why it is such a big deal and I don't understand why your employees are speaking so loudly about me that I can Hear them on the floor. I did nothing wrong here except want what I ordered and paid for. Also I served tables for over 10 years and my husband currently owns a very popular burger restaurant in the area so the service industry is no stranger to me. I'm sorry if you made the burger wrong and don't want to remake it but I paid for a certain item and that is what I expect. After all this commotion I was completely turned off and no longer wanted my food or wanted to be in this establishment anymore as the employees are talking about me loud enough so I can hear them now calling me disgusting and I am being made to feel guilty as if I did something wrong when I just wanted what I paid for. I told the second woman don't bother remaking my food I don't want it. I don't even want to be in here anymore it was completely unprofessional and outrageous that this is happening and I can hear the employees complaining about having to remake my burger the correct way. As I was going to get my mother to leave a manager I assume comes to the table and asked verbatim " are you the one having the issue?"   I looked at him and I said excuse me do you mean am I the customer having the problem, am I the guest having an issue? yes I am. The lack of customer service coming from the manager asking me if I am the one? And not acknowledging me as a customer who paid for food or a guest in this restaurant was despicable. I left the restaurant at that moment because as I said earlier I am nine months pregnant and I was getting far too worked up over a burger that was not made correctly in the first place and all I wanted was the burger I paid for. Bottom line a burger was ordered and paid for and was not made correctly when asked to remake the burger the way it was supposed to be made we received terrible service from every part of that restaurant going from the people on the line to the manager on the floor. It doesn't matter what location you're in or who the customer is, we paid for something that we did not get and we were made to feel bad about it wanting to be fixed. The icing on top of the cake was the way that we were approached by the manager of this establishment.

pQoY4h1J9O_9Ex57PNHWyQ.text: I LOVE everything about this place.  The milkshakes are awesome, the burgers are delicious and those yummy fries!!  This place packs out for lunch and seats fill up fast!   So I tend to go early or later.  Fast casual space that is open and airy feeling.  Grab some friends and check it out!

tZSFXnTzdIdziGa7KilpnQ.text: One of the best burgers that my girlfriend and I have ever had! We both had smoke shacks which were amazing. Very juicy and tender beef with melted American cheese - great! I also had a side of bacon cheese fries. The crinkle fries have an excellent crunch. Service was great and fast. Only complaint is that they are a tad bit pricey, but it is worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States. Double Shack Burger, Crinkle Fries w Cheese Sauce and a Vanilla Shake

IX_Svj1C530TK7mjmN80ow.text: All I can say is lol to this place. It's a bunch of 15 yr Olds serving McDonald like Hamburgers and McDonald's tasting shakes for a crazy price. Americans are out of their minds and I am an American saying this.

trzQmboGyiDEZrmotjqbAw.text: In all fairness, before I get rolling with this, I didn't have a shake. I didn't have the famous frozen custard.  What I did have, the chicken sandwich and crinkle fries, was nothing I would ever get again.  Unfortunately, there was no grilled chicken and my chicken burger was very fried.  The crinkle fries could have been out of a frozen bag of fries.  John said his mushroom burger was like processed food with cheese in it.  Neither of us were impressed.  And, on top of it, the prices were rather steep, we thought. If I were 15 years old and liked regular burgers, this would be my place.  But, I am not that.  I wish they had some healthy alternatives.  Why can't they have one or two salads on the menu?   Why not a grilled chicken sandwich?   The atmosphere was lively, with a lot of teens.  I can check this off my list now, but really need to go back for the custard.   No more fried Shake Shack food for me.

Photo of Shake Shack - Charlotte, NC, United States

bM7eOO1bp0kCs1BaPgcrPQ.text: 12/19 update. I hate to say this, and it will be the first time I've ever given any Shake Shack and I've visited at least 10 throughout the US anything less than 4 stars, but hopefully someone does something to fix it. First, we walk in at 8:30, no one in line and you can see at least 7 people cleaning the grills/friers etc, I ask and they confirm the close at ten...but immediately the cashier tells us they are out of everything except Shack burgers and chicken shacks. Really?? Seems like someone just wants to close up as early as possible and have everything clean and ready to close...we made the trip out so we got some burgers and walked over to five guys and got some fries. Unfortunately that wasn't all...the burgers were bad...they were burnt! Not the normal sear or amazing crust these burgers usually have but a bitter burnt grease taste...just bad. Luckily Fiveguys was still fully operational and we were able to get ourselves some burgers...please someone fix this!! Shake Shack is so much better than this.  I been waiting a looong time. Finally got a Shake Shack in Charlotte, now a second?? Officially not moving from Charlotte anytime soon! I get it for the price you can get a bigger burger at Bad Daddy's or even at 5 guys, but the meat in these burgers is just amazing. Pat LaFreida beef is on another level, that and a Martins potato bun and you barely have to chew. Fries are good, but you don't come here for fries you come for the burgers and the concretes and they do these 2 things better than anyone.

ffKICR8fodKUX1_QESoxfg.text: This heavenly burger and fries combo is hard to beat. Not only are the fries crispy, but adding the bacon and cheese on top really knocked them out of the park. (even a little fork makes it extra fun.) I also love the burgers and the pickles really make it a winner. You can get local brews here as well as local pie in their ice cream! They even have an amazing mushroom burger for vegetarians. The service line moved quickly, and the staff are all very friendly.

5vrlTZS3rXxWxYJczDkj1Q.text: I came to Shake Shack craving a shake as a pick-me-up after a rough day. I had some really specific allergy/nutritional questions about the shake I ordered first though. John and Tamara truly went above and beyond to answer my questions and make me feel comfortable about the shake before ordering. I can't say enough good things about them. It really means a lot for them to be so accommodating to me so I could have that sweet dessert at the end of a long day!  Thank you so much John and Tamara!!
